question.body: Which is the correct structural hierarchy, from microstructure to gross anatomy of the skeletal system?

multiple_choice.choice: Mineral crystals are embedded in lamellae which are organized into collagen fibers which form osteons in compact bone.
Lamellae are embedded in collagen fibers which are organized into trabeculae which form osteons in compact bone.
Mineral crystals are embedded in collagen fibers which are organized into lamellae which form osteons in compact bone.
None of the above is a correct structural hierarchy from microstructure to gross structure of the skeletal system.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The collagen fibers are aligned in parallel sheets to form lamellae.
Incorrect. Trabeculae are not formed from osteons and are not found in compact bone. They are found in spongy bone.
Correct. Mineral crystals are the smallest level and osteons are found in compact bone.
Incorrect. One of the answers above is correct.

part.hint: Microstructure is the smallest part so the order should be smallest to largest. Starting with Nanoscale.
